Package iscteiul.ista

Class PostGISUtils

java.lang.Object
iscteiul.ista.PostGISUtils
public final class PostGISUtils extends Object

PostGISUtils – Bulk Loader and Neighbor Finder

This static-only helper class provides functionality to:

  1. Insert a list of PropertyRecord objects into a PostGIS table (see TABLE_SCHEMA and TABLE_NAME for details).
  2. Query that table for neighboring parcels using standard PostGIS spatial predicates:
    • ST_Touches
    • ST_Intersects
    • ST_Overlaps
    • ST_Contains

Pre-requisites

  1. PostGIS Extension: CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS postgis;
  2. Table Definition: The table "public.properties" (adjust schema if not using public): 
    
       CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS public.properties (
           objectid      INT PRIMARY KEY,
           parcelid      BIGINT,
           parcelnumber  BIGINT,
           shapelength   DOUBLE PRECISION,
           shapearea     DOUBLE PRECISION,
           geometry      geometry(MultiPolygon,4326),
           owner         INT,
           parish        TEXT,
           municipality  TEXT,
           island        TEXT
       );

Adjust the constants TABLE_SCHEMA, TABLE_NAME, and the connection details if your database settings differ.

Author: Your Name (2025)

  • Method Details

    • insertPropertyRecords

      public static void insertPropertyRecords(List<PropertyRecord> records)
      Inserts each PropertyRecord into the PostGIS table "public.properties". The geometry column is populated by invoking ST_GeomFromText(?::text, 4326).

      Records that lack a non-empty geometry field are skipped with a warning. Adjust logic if you need to handle those cases differently.

      Parameters:
      records - a list of PropertyRecord objects to be inserted (each must have valid WKT geometry in PropertyRecord.getGeometry())

    • unionByOwner

      public static String unionByOwner(int ownerId)
      Merges (UNION) every parcel that belongs to a given owner into a single MultiPolygon and returns it as WKT text.
      Parameters:
      ownerId - the owner column value
      Returns:
      WKT of the merged geometry, or null if the owner has no rows (or on error)

    • intersection

      public static String intersection(int objectIdA, int objectIdB)
      Returns the geometric intersection of two parcels as WKT.
      Parameters:
      objectIdA - first parcel’s objectID
      objectIdB - second parcel’s objectID
      Returns:
      WKT of the intersection polygon, or null if the geometries do not intersect (or on error)

    • distance

      public static Double distance(int objectIdA, int objectIdB)
      Returns the shortest planar distance between two parcel geometries (in the unit of the layer’s SRID – for EPSG : 4326 that is metres when your data are in a projected CRS, otherwise degrees).
      Parameters:
      objectIdA - first parcel’s objectid
      objectIdB - second parcel’s objectid
      Returns:
      distance as double, or null if one id is missing or a DB error occurs

    • withinDistance

      public static Boolean withinDistance(int objectIdA, int objectIdB, double distance)
      Convenience wrapper around ST_DWithin. It answers the question “are the two parcels closer than the given distance?”.
      Parameters:
      objectIdA - first parcel
      objectIdB - second parcel
      distance - threshold distance in the unit of the SRID
      Returns:
      true / false, or null on error

    • distanceToFunchal

      public static Double distanceToFunchal(int objectId)
      Computes the shortest planar distance between the given property (by objectId) and the "Funchal (Sé)" property in the database with FUNCHAL_SE_OBJECT_ID.

      Internally calls distance(int, int), which returns null if either parcel doesn’t exist or on DB error. If your data is in EPSG:4326, this distance is in degrees. For meters, your geometry must be in a projected CRS.

      Parameters:
      objectId - the ID of the parcel whose distance to Funchal we want
      Returns:
      the distance (in the layer’s SRID units) from objectId to #11074, or null if the row is missing or an error occurs

    • area

      public static Double area(int objectId)
      Calculates the planar area of a parcel, using ST_Area(geometry) in the database.
      Parameters:
      objectId - the parcel’s objectid
      Returns:
      the area in square units of the layer’s SRID, or null if the row is missing / DB error

    • centroid

      public static String centroid(int objectId)
      Computes the centroid of a parcel geometry and returns the point as WKT text (e.g. POINT(x y)).
      Parameters:
      objectId - the parcel’s objectid
      Returns:
      WKT of the centroid point, or null if not found / error

    • findTouching

      public static List<PropertyRecord> findTouching(int objectId)
      Finds all parcels in the database that touch (share a boundary but do not overlap) the parcel whose objectID is given.
      Parameters:
      objectId - the reference parcel's ID
      Returns:
      a list of PropertyRecord that touch the reference parcel

    • findIntersecting

      public static List<PropertyRecord> findIntersecting(int objectId)
      Finds all parcels that intersect (share any point) the parcel whose objectID is given.
      Parameters:
      objectId - the reference parcel's ID
      Returns:
      a list of PropertyRecord that intersect the reference parcel

    • findOverlapping

      public static List<PropertyRecord> findOverlapping(int objectId)
      Finds all parcels that overlap the parcel whose objectID is given. Overlapping implies partial interior intersection but not full containment.
      Parameters:
      objectId - the reference parcel's ID
      Returns:
      a list of PropertyRecord that overlap the reference parcel

    • findContained

      public static List<PropertyRecord> findContained(int objectId)
      Finds all parcels that are contained within the geometry of the parcel whose objectID is given. This uses ST_Contains(A,B), meaning A (the reference) fully encloses B.
      Parameters:
      objectId - the reference parcel's ID
      Returns:
      a list of PropertyRecord that lie inside the reference parcel

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Minimal command-line demonstration:
      1. Reads the CSV (via CSVFileReader) into memory.
      2. (Optional) calls insertPropertyRecords(List) exactly once to populate the database table.
      3. Prompts for an objectID and prints neighbors for four standard predicates: ST_Touches, ST_Intersects, ST_Overlaps, ST_Contains.

      Adapt or remove if you have a different application entry point.

      Parameters:
      args - ignored
